_meta.purpose: Ground Truth for AI Triage Agent. NOT for final diagnosis.

diabetes_hypoglycemia.triage_logic: If conscious -> Priority 2. If unconscious -> Priority 1.
diabetes_hypoglycemia.protocol: Immediate intake of 15g fast-acting sugar (3 spoons sugar, glucose powder, fruit juice, or hard candy). Wait 15 mins. If not better, repeat. Do NOT give insulin.

diabetes_hyperglycemia.triage_logic: If red flags present (DKA risk) -> Priority 1. Else -> Priority 3.
diabetes_hyperglycemia.protocol: Drink plenty of water (sugar-free). Check ketones if possible. Continue medication as prescribed. If sugar > 300 mg/dL repeatedly, consult doctor.

hypertension.triage_logic: If chest pain/numbness -> Priority 1 (Heart Attack/Stroke risk). Else -> Priority 2.
hypertension.protocol: Sit down and rest immediately. Do not smoke or drink coffee. Take prescribed BP medication if missed. If BP > 180/120, go to hospital.

dengue_malaria.triage_logic: If bleeding/severe pain -> Priority 1 (Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever). Else -> Priority 2.
dengue_malaria.protocol: Hydration is critical (ORS, Coconut water). Rest. Paracetamol for fever. WARNING: Do NOT take Aspirin or Ibuprofen (increases bleeding risk).

viral_fever.triage_logic: If breathing issues -> Priority 1. Else -> Priority 3.
viral_fever.protocol: Warm saline gargle. Steam inhalation. Hydration. Paracetamol if fever > 100°F. Isolate if possible.

gastroenteritis.triage_logic: If severe dehydration signs -> Priority 1. Else -> Priority 2.
gastroenteritis.protocol: Start ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) immediately. Sip slowly. Avoid solid food for a few hours. Avoid milk/dairy.

myocardial_infarction.protocol: Stop all activity. Sit down. Loosen tight clothing. Chew 300mg Aspirin (Disprin) if available and not allergic. Call Ambulance/Neighbor immediately.

stroke.protocol: Note the time symptoms started. Do not give food or water (choking risk). Transport to hospital immediately.

snake_bite.protocol: Immobilize the limb (do not move it). Keep limb below heart level. Do NOT suck venom. Do NOT tie tight tourniquet. Transport to hospital.

asthma_copd.triage_logic: If red flags -> Priority 1. Else -> Priority 2.
asthma_copd.protocol: Sit upright. Use Rescue Inhaler (Puffs) immediately. Pursed-lip breathing. Keep calm.

anemia.protocol: Iron-rich diet (Spinach, Jaggery/Gud, Dates). Hydration. Consult doctor for Iron/Folic acid supplements.
